conclusion: Understand how the position and size of shadows change when the light source moves downward.
Shadow A of the ice cream cup is cast to the left and slightly forward.
Shadow B of the typewriter is cast to the right and slightly forward.
Shadow C of the ball is cast to the right and slightly backward.
Shadow D of the object with the black top and white base is cast to the right and slightly backward.
Effect of moving the light source downward: shadows will be more vertical and closer to objects.
Shadow A will move closer to the ice cream cup and become shorter, direction more vertical.
Shadow B will move closer to the typewriter and become shorter, direction more vertical.
Shadow C will move closer to the ball and become shorter, direction more vertical.
Shadow D will move closer to the object and become shorter, direction more vertical.
All shadows will become shorter and more vertical, positions closer to objects.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will become shorter and more vertical, positions closer to objects.
